byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin and Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting.

abstract: Paris police arrest three Al Jazeera journalists for flying drone over large part on western edge of city; arrests come amid mounting anxiety over unauthorized objects seen in city's skies; journalists are thought to have been capturing footage for news piece, but flying drones over city without permission is prohibited.
lead_paragraph: The arrests came after a second straight night of unidentified flying objects being spotted over some of Paris’s most identifiable landmarks.

headline.main: French Hold 3 Journalists in Drone Episodes, but No Link to Earlier Flights Is Seen
headline.print_headline: French Hold 3 Journalists in Drone Episodes, but No Link to Earlier Flights Is Seen

snippet: The arrests came after a second straight night of unidentified flying objects being spotted over some of Paris’s most identifiable landmarks.
